snippet: New satellite images show steam emerging from a nuclear reactor in North Korea, suggesting that the country may be making good on its promise to resume the production of plutonium for its small nuclear arsenal.
abstract: New satellite images show steam emerging from nuclear reactor in North Korea, suggesting that country may be making good on its promise to resume production of plutonium for its small nuclear arsenal.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, WILLIAM J. BROAD and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, William J. Broad from New York, and Choe Sang-Hun from Kyoto, Japan.

lead_paragraph: New satellite images show steam emerging from a nuclear reactor in North Korea, suggesting that the country may be making good on its promise to resume the production of plutonium for its small nuclear arsenal.

headline.main: North Korea Appears to Restart Plutonium Reactor
headline.print_headline: North Korea Appears to Restart Plutonium Reactor
